articles.title: Anti-DPRK Campaign of S. Korean Puppet Reptile Writers Will Be Foiled: Journalists Union of Korea
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Campaign of S. Korean Puppet Reptile Writers Will Be Foiled: Journalists Union of Korea
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Yonhap News, Chosun Ilbo, Dong-A Ilbo, Maeil Kyongje, Munhwa Ilbo and other vicious conservative media of south Korea professing to represent the south Korean media are speaking ill of the Korean People's Army's resolute warning for mounting enveloping fire on Guam and the will of the Korean people to wage death-defying resistance against the U.S. and are unhesitatingly trumpeting about such rhetoric as "enhanced war atmosphere" and "creation of tensions for maintaining social system".
					 A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Journalists Union of Korea in a statement Friday says this clearly proves that the puppet conservative media are made up of hack writers, servants of bellicose forces at home and abroad and group of traitors with whom we can not live together.
					
					 The Central Committee of the Journalists Union of Korea sternly declares as follows reflecting the towering grudge and hostility of the mediapersons of the DPRK against the puppet conservative media going reckless to hurt the dignity of the DPRK while pointing an accusing finger at the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK:
					
					1. We will sharpen the just writing brushes to defend our leader, our party and our social system and win a final victory in the confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 No matter how loudly the hostile forces may cry out, they can never check the advance of the DPRK dashing toward the bright future of humankind along the straight road of independence, Songun and socialism.
					
					2. We will track down the puppet conservative reptile writers fostering discord within the nation under the auspices and at the instigation of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad, and throw overboard all of them.
					
					 The puppet ultra-right conservative hack writers without elementary conscience as writers have to be completely stamped out. This is the unanimous will of the mediapersons of the DPRK, and this will be put into practice.
					
					3. Our grime and merciless pen will sight the bases which commit hideous crimes against the DPRK by spreading misinformation about it, and beat them to pieces.
					
					 The puppet conservative media escalating confrontation with the DPRK while dare challenge the annihilating spirit of the army and people of the DPRK will never be able to evade the shower of retaliatory blows.

articles.title: Greetings to C.C., Popular Liberation Movement of Angola
articles.content:
Greetings to C.C., Popular Liberation Movement of Angola
Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to the Central Committee of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola on August 30.
					 The Popular Liberation Movement of Angola's victory in the general election this time again is an expression of the full support and trust of the Angolan people in the movement, the message said.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola was forged and have been steadily consolidated since the Angolan people waged the national liberation struggle, it noted.
					
					 It expressed belief that the historic relations between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola forged in the common struggle for independence against imperialism will grow stronger in the common interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 It wished the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola greater successes in its activities for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Greets FM of Slovakia
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Greets FM of Slovakia
 Pyongyang. September 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho of the DPRK Friday sent a message of greeting to Miroslav Lajcak, minister of Foreign Affairs and Relations with Europe of Slovakia, on the occasion of its national day. 
					 The message expressed belief that the dialogue and cooperation would be strengthened between the two foreign ministries to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan Arrives
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation for marking the 70th anniversary of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan led by Kim Il Sun, adviser to its Central Standing Committee, arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Preparations for World Taekwon-Do Championships near Completion
articles.content:
Preparations for World Taekwon-Do Championships near Completion
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The 20th World Taekwon-Do Championships are to be held in Pyongyang, the capital city of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, from September 15 to 21. On this occasion, preparations for the championships are in progress at the final stage.
					 According to a person concerned, there were entries for the championships from teams of over 70 countries and regions.
					
					 The Taekwon-Do Hall was remodeled as the center for the development of the national martial arts.
					
					 Preparations for the successful opening and closing ceremonies are on the move.
					
					 Meanwhile, various programs for supporting matches were developed and hundreds of pieces of apparatuses and furniture were provided.
					
					 The DPRK hosted the 8th and 17th World Taekwon-Do Championships in 1992 and 2011 and the 5th World Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championship in 2000.

articles.title: Construction of Tanchon Power Station Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Construction of Tanchon Power Station Progresses Apace
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The first-stage project of the Tanchon Power Station is progressing apace in the DPRK.
					 According to data available, the builders made a breakthrough in tunneling of working pits and are accelerating the project for installing power equipment and laying transmission lines at the final stage.
					
					 Every unit is doing a preparatory work for laying electricity lines in the spirit of self-reliance.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Confrontation and Pressure on DPRK as Futile Actions
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Confrontation and Pressure on DPRK as Futile Actions
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. had better worry about its destiny, not to clinging to the futile confrontation and pressure on the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists were engrossed in nuclear threat and blackmail upon the Korean people in the past, but now they have a hard time facing a miserable destiny.
					
					 The DPRK, a world military power, is pressurizing the U.S. and big powers presenting themselves as leading ones are acting as chess pieces of the U.S., "the world's only superpower" trembling with fear. All this patently proves by whom the world political map is being changed.
					
					 The situation is turning unfavorable for the U.S. day by day. There is no proper way out.
					
					 The U.S. should make a switchover in its policy on the basis of recognizing the fundamentally changed DPRK strategic position and geographical influence.
					
					 The changed situation calls for putting the issue of ensuring the security of the U.S. mainland on the negotiations, not the issue of the DPRK's nuclear deterrent.
					
					 Under the situation where the DPRK has wringed the neck of the U.S., things cannot change though the U.S. urges other countries to sever the relations with the DPRK. It will only be a trouble-maker.
					
					 The confrontation with the DPRK can never guarantee the security of the U.S. mainland.
					
					 As the U.S. escalates the confrontation with the DPRK and wastes time to find out a solution, the striking capabilities of the DPRK's strategic forces which put the whole U.S. mainland in their strike range will rapidly increase.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Interfering in DPRK-U.S. Issue
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Interfering in DPRK-U.S. Issue
Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers of the DPRK on Friday carry a commentary written by Dr. Jo Nam Jin, a researcher on the south Korean issues, to denounce the south Korean authorities for wandering in the darkness while turning a deaf ear to the voices of the world heralding the changed world political atmosphere.
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Now the south Korean authorities say that another war should not be allowed on the Korean peninsula, sanctions against the north and dialogue with it are not the matter of priority, dialogue is possible if the north stops additional nuclear development and that the history of the "nuclear issue of the north showed that the first stage for settling the issue was opened" when sanctions and dialogue simultaneously go. The frog in the well does not know the ocean.
					
					 They have no strength to "prevent a war" on the Korean peninsula as they are in the situation of colonial servant of the U.S. and they cannot fire even a bullet without approval of the master U.S., being deprived of the right to command the wartime operation.
					
					 Their saying that sanctions against the north and dialogue with it are not the matter of priority and they should go together means one body simultaneously goes to the east and west. This is ridiculous enough to make even the boiled head of a cow provoke laughter.
					
					 They regard sanctions and dialogue as means for "dismantlement of nukes." Even a chimpanzee in a zoo would choose better option than that of the south Korean authorities.
					
					 Their talking about the history of the nuclear issue of the north shows that they lost their memory.
					
					 If they impertinently involve in the DPRK-U.S. issue to deal with the nuclear problem, they would get hurt themselves. They would be well advised to learn the way to understand the trend of the times without meddling in the matter.

articles.title: Papers Call for Strengthening Non-Aligned Movement
articles.content:
Papers Call for Strengthening Non-Aligned Movement
Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers of the DPRK Friday observe the Day of the Non-Aligned Movement.
					 Noting that the Non-Aligned Movement has dynamically advanced under the banner of independence against imperialism since its birth, Rodong Sinmun in an article says:
					
					 Many years have passed, but the aim of the NAM has not yet been realized and there are still a lot of things to do.
					
					 The DPRK has always been faithful to the fundamental idea and principle of the NAM till now since it became its full-fledged member. And it has fully discharged its mission in the struggle to establish a fair international relationship and achieve global peace and security.
					
					 It is the desire of humankind to strengthen the NAM and live in a peaceful world free from war by realizing independence of the whole world. It is an invariable stand of the DPRK government to struggle to this end.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever do its utmost to achieve the unity and cohesion of the movement and its development.
					
					 Minju Joson says in an article that the NAM should make a positive contribution to realizing the peace and security of the world and victoriously advancing the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Minju Joson Discloses S. Korean Authorities' Intention Lurking behind "Dialogue" Rhetoric
articles.content:
Minju Joson Discloses S. Korean Authorities' Intention Lurking behind "Dialogue" Rhetoric
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The "conditions for dialogue" touted much by the south Korean authorities are sophism that smacks of flunkeyism towards the U.S. and confrontation with the fellow countrymen, says a commentary of Minju Joson Friday.
					 The "conditions for dialogue" are a replica of "halt to nuclear test, stop to ballistic missile test-launch and stop to provocative words" which the Trump group put up as "three conditions" for the DPRK-U.S. dialogue, and sophism of "denuclearization first" claimed by the Park Geun Hye regime.
					
					 The purpose of the "dialogue" rhetoric let out by the south Korean authorities is to attain their dirty intention by taking advantage of the U.S. imperialists' hostile policy toward the DPRK to the last.
					
					 The "conditions for dialogue" touted by those indifferent to the destiny of the nation pursuant to outsiders, being unaware of the essence of the nuclear issue of the Korean peninsula, are nothing but a pipe dream.
					
					 The commentary says that the south Korean authorities, which regard it as its destiny to rely on the U.S. with sycophancy toward it, should come to their senses, though belatedly, bearing in mind that they can face the same miserable end as traitor Park who was pushed into the abyss of destruction for pursuing sycophancy and confrontation with the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia brought out in booklet respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "Young People, Be Vanguard Fighters Who Are Unfailingly Faithful to the Party's Revolutionary Cause of Songun" on August 23 to mark the Day of Songun.
					 The work, published on September 18, Juche 103 (2014), says that the Korean youths had covered a glorious course, adding shine to the annals of revolution with their heroic exploits and brilliant victory under the wise guidance and benevolent loving care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It indicates tasks and ways for the Korean youths to creditably play their role in the ongoing advance as the youth vanguard of the Party.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Supported Abroad
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of different countries expressed support for the just cause of the Korean people between August 20 and 22.
					 The Central Committee of the Communist Party of the People of Spain in its declaration vehemently denounced the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 Noting that the U.S. is keen on violating the sovereignty of other countries and imposing economic sanctions on them, regarding them as its colonies, the declaration termed the joint military drills kicked off by the U.S. in league with the south Korean puppet forces a war rehearsal for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 It fully supported the unshakable stand of the DPRK to put a definite end to the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula and protect regional and global peace.
					
					 The Union for Communist Reconstruction of Brazil in its solidarity letter to the Korean people said Trump fully revealed the imperialists' aggressive nature by unhesitatingly letting out war-inciting remarks against socialist Korea.
					
					 All the successes and victories achieved by the Korean people in socialist construction serve as a victory of the world progressives, the letter stressed. It fully supported the DPRK's access to nukes, saying this serves as a main guarantee for protecting and advancing socialism.
					
					 The Workers' United Trade Union of the Peruvian National Association for Children's Health in a statement said that the DPRK is a peace-loving country which is possessed of nukes to protect the security of the nation, urging the UNSC to retract the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" at once.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Exploits Lauded by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Exploits Lauded by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries carried write-ups between Aug. 17 and 23 to mark the 57th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The Pakistani newspaper Election Times said:
					
					 Aug. 25 is the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il's visit to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on Aug. 25, 1960 was an event of weighty significance.
					
					 It was a meaningful declaration on how the person responsible for leading the DPRK would guide the country and its people by regarding what his motto was.
					
					 The newspaper introduced in detail that Kim Jong Il had led the fierce showdown with the U.S. to victory with his distinguished Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Cambodia's State Radio Broadcasting Service said that Kim Jong Il showed his iron will to guide the revolution and construction with Songun through his visit to a tank division of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 It stressed that thanks to Kim Jong Il's transparent Songun will and pluck and courage, the DPRK had bolstered up its self-defensive nuclear deterrence to stand up against the U.S. persistent nuclear threat and blackmail.
					
					 Russia's newspaper Zavtra and websites edited articles saying that thanks to his Songun revolutionary guidance, single-minded unity of the Korean society was consolidated, the DPRK's military might strengthened and foundation for building a socialist power provided.

articles.title: UPC rechaza la demagogia anti-RPDC de publicaciones conservadoras surcoreanas
articles.content:
UPC rechaza la demagogia anti-RPDC de publicaciones conservadoras surcoreanas
Pyongyang, primero de septiembre (ACNC) -- Yonhap News, Chosun Ilbo, Dong-A Ilbo, Maeil Kyongje, Munhwa Ilbo y otros connotados medios conservadores sueltan sin escrupulos los disparates como el "aumento del clima de guerra" y la "creacion de la tension para el mantenimiento del sistema" calumniando brutalmente la advertencia del Ejercito Popular de Corea sobre el disparo de cerco a la isla Guam y la firme voluntad de resistencia del pueblo coreano contra el imperialismo norteamericano. 
					El hecho demuestra claramente que los medios de prensa conservadores surcoreanos son la horda de escritores venales, traidores a la nacion y sirvientes de las fuerzas belicistas internas y externas.
					
					Senala asi el portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de Periodistas de Corea en una declaracion publicada este viernes y continua:
					
					Reflejando la colera y enemistad irrefrenables de los hombres de prensa de la RPDC contra los medios de prensa conservadores surcoreanas que estan desesperados para manchar el prestigio de la RPDC calumniando atrevidamente su maxima dignidad, el Comite Central de la UPC declara solemnemente como lo siguiente:
					
					1.  Defenderemos a nuestro lider, nuestro partido y nuestro regimen y afilaremos mas agudamente la pluma de justicia para lograr la victoria final en la confrontacion antiyanqui. 
					
					 Por mas que las fuerzas hostiles suelten los disparates anti-RPDC, no pueden detener nunca el avance de la RPDC que marcha a galopes por el camino recto de la independencia, el Songun y el socialismo hacia el radiante futuro de la humanidad. 
					
					2. Perseguiremos hasta el final y sepultaremos a los escritores venales conservadores surcoreanos que siembran la discordia en el interior de la nacion bajo el amparo y la instigacion de las fuerzas internas y externas opositoras a la reunificacion.
					
					 Se pondra sin falta en practica la unanime voluntad de los hombres de prensa de la RPDC de eliminar completamente a los escritores venales ultraderechistas carentes de la conciencia elemental del hombre de prensa. 
					
					3.  Nuestros pinceles implacables se entregaran a destruir con precision los nidos de la demagogia anti-RPDC.
					
					No podran evitar el castigo severo los medios de prensa conservadores del Sur de Corea que se entregan con frenesi a la imprudencia conflictiva anti-RPDC desafiando atrevidamente al firme impetu de los militares y habitantes de la RPDC de aniquilar a los enemigos.

articles.title: Se impulsan en etapa final los preparativos de Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo
articles.content:
Se impulsan en etapa final los preparativos de Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo
Pyongyang, primero de septiembre (ACNC) -- Se impulsan en etapa final en la ciudad de Pyongyang los preparativos para el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo (15-21 de septiembre).
					  Segun un hombre interesado, hasta la fecha las selecciones de mas de 70 paises y regiones solicitaron participar en la presente cita.
					
					El Palacio de Taekwondo, escogido como sede del campeonato, se ha remozado como centro de desarrollo de arte marcial ortodoxo de la nacion.
					
					Todos los puntos del palacio, incluyendo el salon con miles de asiento, la sala de espera de jugadores y otras para el tratamiento medico, los jueces, la comunicacion internacional y la entrevista de prensa, fueron remodelados para garantizar con satisfaccion la celebracion del certamen.
					
					Estan en progreso varios proyectos orientados a asegurar exitosamente las ceremonias inaugural y clausural.
					
					Se adornan de modo singular el interior y el exterior del palacio. 
					
					Por otra parte, se desarrollaron varios programas de asistencia a competencia y estan bien asegurados centenares de equipos y mobiliarios de decenas de generos. 
					
					Los entrenadores y jugadores coreanos estan bien decididos a exaltar el honor de la patria de Taekwondo en este campeonato que se realizara bajo el ideal de la justicia y la paz.
					
					La RPDC auspicio en 1992 y 2011 los 8o y 17o campeonatos mundiales de Taekwondo, respectivamente, y en 2000 el 5o Campeonato Mundial de Jovenes de Taekwondo.
